online.game This package contains everything a to support actual games.

Uses of PlayConstants in hex
 

Subinterfaces of PlayConstants in hex
 interface HexConstants
           
 

Classes in hex that implement PlayConstants
 class hexblob
          a service class for the hex board/robot to keep track of blobs of like-colored markers.
 class hexCell
          specialized cell used for the game hex, not for all games using a hex board.
 class hexChip
          this is a specialization of chip to represent the stones used by hex; and also other tiles, borders and other images that are used to draw the board.
 class HexGameViewer
          This is intended to be maintained as the reference example how to interface to boardspace.
 class Hexmovespec
           
 class HexPlay
          the Robot player only has to implement the basic methods to generate and evaluate moves.
 

Uses of PlayConstants in online.game
 

Subinterfaces of PlayConstants in online.game
 interface Play2Constants
          a collection of constants appropriate for 2 player games, but not appropriate for games with more players.
 interface Play6Constants
           
 

Classes in online.game that implement PlayConstants
 class BaseBoard
          this is the recommended lowest level class for Boardspace boards.
 class ccell<FINALTYPE extends ccell<FINALTYPE>>
          some legacy or simple games use just a "char" to indicate the contents of the cell.
 class cell<FINALTYPE extends cell<FINALTYPE>>
          this is the common cell which can be used by all boards.
 class chipCell<FINALTYPE extends chipCell<FINALTYPE,COMPONENTTYPE>,COMPONENTTYPE extends chip<?>>
          this is the principal subclass of cell for cells whose contents is just a single object.
 class circBoard<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>>
          Base class for boards with radial symmetry.
 class commonCanvas
          This class extends exCanvas and provides a bunch of services for the individual game's Viewer class.
 class commonMove
          this class is the basis for representing individual moves in the game.
 class commonMPMove
          this is a suitable base class for the "move" class of games which have more than 2 players.
 class commonPlayer
          this class holds information about players.
 class dummyMove
          this is a class used to insert messages into the raw move history of a game.
 class Game
          todo: fix "scoring rejected" caused when players reconnect after game over todo: fix "save game failed" caused by too fast games.
 class GameLayoutManager
          this is the expert for constructing board layouts.
 class gBoard<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>>
           
 class hexBoard<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>>
          support for generic hex boards in various convex shapes, including coordinate system transforms and drawing functions.
 class RBoard<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>>
          a board where the cells have random locations, not in a regular grid.
 class rectBoard<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>>
          the generic part of all rectangular boards with diagonal connections
 class square_geo_board<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>>
          common support for square geometry boards with connections in 2 4 or 8 directions.
 class squareBoard<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>>
          support a square board with no diagonal links.
 class stackCell<FINALTYPE extends stackCell<FINALTYPE,COMPONENTTYPE>,COMPONENTTYPE extends chip<?>>
          stackCell extends cell with a stack of chips.
 class trackBoard<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>>
          Implement a one dimensional board with a race track around the edges, like a monopoly board.
 class triBoard<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>>
          support for generic triangular grid boards.
